decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Before the building/extension hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the petro elevation of the shall be glazed with obscured glass and fixed shut and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 3 - The developer shall provide adequate facilities for appropriate investigation of this archaeologically important site in advance of redevelopment, by an investigating body to be nominated by the Council.  Reason for Condition: To ensure that there is an opportunity to properly investigate and record information on this site, which is considered to be of high archaeological importance. Informative: This site is within an area of historical importance, where ground works will result in the destruction of archaeological remains. Your attention is drawn to the existence of a Code of Practice agreed by the British Property Federation and SCAUM. The Council expects the applicants and the nominated investgating body to abide by the provision of this code.

Condition : 4 - Prior to the use of the petrol filling station a traffic management scheme including road markings and sign posting is to be agreed in writing and implmented to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition:To maintain highway safety.

Condition : 5 - No car sales, no display of vehicles for sale, no repair work or vehicle maintenance shall be carried out on the site without prior approval from the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition:To protect the visual amenities of the locality.
description: ERECTION OF A PETROL FILLING STATION WITH ASSOCIATED ACCESS ROAD.
